description: Construction of two semi-detached dwelling houses with accommodation in the roof space, including associated amenity space, cycle storage and refuse storage provision (following demolition of garage)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Block Plan ref. 1094 M101 rev B, received 19 September 2017; Site Location Map 1-1250 ref. 1094 M100 rev B, received 19 September 2017; Floor Plan as Existing ref. 1094 E100, received 19 September 2017; GA-Proposed Ground-1st Floor ref. 1094 A110 rev B, received 19 September 2017; GA-Proposed 2nd Floor-Roof ref. 1094 A111 rev B, received 19 September 2017; Proposed Front & West Elevation ref. 1094 A210 rev B, received 19 September 2017; Proposed Rear & East Elevation ref. 1094 A211 rev B, received 19 September 2017; Section_As Proposed ref. 1094 A300 rev B, received 19 September 2017; Area Plans, Room Schedule ref. 1094 A900 rev B, received 19 September 2017; Downing Drive New Build (R/O 854-856-858 Greenford Road, Middlesex UB6 8QW), received 19 September 2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage are provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E or F of Part 1 and Class A of Part 2 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 and/or any subsequent amendment, no alterations or extensions to the dwellings hereby approved, outbuildings within their curtilage or gate, fence, wall or other means of enclosure around the curtilage shall be erected without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of the residents of adjoining properties and the dwelling hereby approved and the visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| A minimum of four cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 40 mg/kWh shall be completed prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to first occupation of the dwellings and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first occupation of the dwellings and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| A detailed method statement relating to the construction of the two (2) semi-detached dwellings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development.  The statement shall include the following details:
a.	Removal of any earth from the site.
b.	Site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction methods.
c.	Site management and access.
d.	Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site.
e.	Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on nearby roads.
f.	Vehicle and machinery specification.
g.	Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h.	Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i.	Parking of construction vehicles.
j.	Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l.	Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m.	Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

Reason:  In the interest of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The existing dropped kerb along the site frontage to Downing Drive shall be re-instated prior to the first occupation of the dwellings and maintained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interest of the visual amenity of the street scene and in the interest of highway safety in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 6.13 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2016).
